column1:
gordi99,"2011-01-04T20:39:11.597Z","I LOVE SLAVE 1's","

Hi there, I just want to congrajilate lego on this amazing mini set. It has very nice details to the original.

column12: -wings go from landing to flying mode just like real thing!&nbsp

column7: Anyways, great addition to any collector&nbsp
column8: and I advise buying it if you have real moldel to.

column1:
PluffTed,"2011-01-05T21:10:39.39Z","Brickmaster saved the best for last!","

I just got my mini boba fett slave I in the mail today!
column2: Bet a lot of you are sad because this was the last Brickmaster toy and even had a note stapled to the magazine.&nbsp
column3: Anyway, I think this is one of the greatest Brickmaster sets ever.&nbsp
column4: It's very big, detailed, and really movie-accurate.&nbsp
column5: If any of you are wondering about playability, the wings can swivel just like any other slave I and the cannons can rotate.&nbsp
column6: The only problem I have with this set is that the little binoculars piece for the tip of the cannons just loves to pop off.&nbsp
column7: Other than that, I have no problems with this set.&nbsp
column8:
Very great edition to my Star Wars Minis collection and I totally recommend this set to any Lego lover!

",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

column1:
MCLegoboy,"2011-01-11T19:18:10.24Z","Overlookable Proportion Problems","

I recently got this as my final Brickmaster (Subscripton ended in January.)
column2: and I think everything is great, except that it's a little fat.&nbsp
column3: The wings are too big to me.&nbsp
column4: I get that it is a mini model and&nbsp
column6: it's got for small sets, it just seemed a little out of proportion.&nbsp
column7: I can overlook it enough though&nbsp
column10:
a five out of five, a great ending to my Brickmaster subscription as it is Star Wars and the fact that mini models are so much fun to play with.

",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

column1:
ShilohCyan,"2021-12-17T20:59:19.987Z","Better than it should be","

Recently got into mini SW ships and parted out a dozen or two from Bricklink. This is the version of Slave I I chose. I realise not many people will even read this so long after its relevance but I can'
Out of the dozens of minis I'
column2: ve built this is by far my favorite and I&#39
column3: m not even a Boba Fett fanboy.&nbsp
column4: The shaping is so satisfying and the wings tilt with gravity better than the 2021 minifig scale set does. The colors&nbsp
column6: despite the lack of sand green but maybe those details didn&#39

column1: My single complaint is the use of 1x2x1
column2: and adjacent 1x1x.66 slopes on the bottom section, when corner slopes that exist could&#39
column3: ve rounded out those contours a lot better, but if this was the only set that year they&#39
column4: d make that part in metrum red for, I guess it can be forgiven.&nbsp

column1: Love this little thing. Makes a grown man wanna swoosh it around.

,TRUE,5,4,4,5,5 22896mbw","2011-01-06T23:44:18.29Z","A Great Mini Slave I!","

This is an amazing set, especially for a Brickmaster set! I can't explain the coolness of the Slave I! I also own the $80 Slave I, so I compared it (they look like replicas!). Now on to the pros and cons...

• Design is absolutely fantastic
  • Wings rotate like other Slave I set
  • Good use of wheel plate
  • Rare colored pieces
  • The price

column2: I recently received this in a trade at BrickFair&nbsp
column3: and was astonished by the amount of accuracy this little packs in.

column1: -The wings move when you tilt the ship.
-Binocular pieces fall off when you move the cannons.
